# replace(withImage:options:)

**Instance Method**

Dynamically replaces the texture with a Core Graphics image.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency func replace(withImage cgImage: CGImage, options: TextureResource.CreateOptions) throws
```

## Parameters

- **cgImage**: The source image.
- **options**: Options that specify the type of texture to create.

## Discussion

This method blocks until the resource updates. Don’t use this method for updates at frame-rate frequency. For frequent texture changes, see [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/TextureResource/replace(withDrawables:)]. If you have an attached [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/TextureResource/DrawableQueue-swift.class] on this resource, this function detaches it.

To  ensure consistent usage of this texture resource, pass the same semantic in `options` that you use to create the resource.



## Modifying the texture

- **replace(withDrawables:)**: Dynamically replaces the texture with a drawable queue.
- **replace(using:options:)**: Asynchronously replaces the texture with a Core Graphics image.
- **replace(with:)**: Replaces a texture resource with a low-level texture.
